result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Sweed Sabbath was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges including DV and DNA surcharge, and restitution. If any, from bail on deposit.  If there is no bail posted, to pay within one year of today's date.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

To report no later than 10/23/2015.
Huber/release privileges for work, childcare and spousal care.
Court advised defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Sweed Sabbath

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Sweed Sabbath in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.  Additional statement by:  Rebecca K.
.
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 40 days at the House of Correction with Huber/release privileges for work, child care and spousal case, with 10 days credit.  Defendant to report no later than 10/23/2015.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges, and restitution, if any, from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges within one year of today's date, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Christopher Sweed Sabbath in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
On motion of  the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered charge amended to "Disorderly Conduct", pursuant to Wisconsin statutes 947.01(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Defendant wants to change his plea.
.
As to count as amended:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
.
At the request of the victim, Rebecca K., court ordered that the no contact order is modified to no violent contact.
Case adjourned for sentencing in branch 36.
Jury trial date of 10/14 vacated.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Sweed Sabbath in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. New counsel is appointed to the case and has the file from prior counsel. Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Sweed Sabbath in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court recalled the case on the record.  
cab\
Defendant asks the court for a new attorney.  Court grants the request.
Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel on 08/12/15 at 08:30 a.m.

Defendant Christopher Sweed Sabbath in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court called the case on the record.  
The court met at side bar with the parties.
Case passed......

Court reviewed and returned paternity information to defense. Defense request to amend the no contact order. State objected. Court allowed for SUPERVISED Contact with the minor children through defendant's parents. No Contact Order remains with the victim, except for third party contact through defendant's parents to arrange for contact with the children.

Defendant Christopher Sweed Sabbath in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial, all conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 08/05/2015.
Request for modification of the No Contact orders.  State opposes.  Court orders the No Contact order to remain.

Defendant Christopher Sweed Sabbath in court with attorney Reyna Morales for Francisco Araiza.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM020581  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/20/2015

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with Rebecca K  and  children: LS, LS.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher Sweed Sabbath in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Christopher Sweed Sabbath in custody.  
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Commissioner Orders the Sheriff Department to collect DNA from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Case adjourned April 27, 2015 at 8:30am for Pretrial Conference in Branch 23.

CASE RECALLED AT 12:03 PM
SAME APPEARANCES.

Court advised defendant the order for DNA Sample previously ordered is Vacated.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher Sweed Sabbath
Current: 1400 15th Avenue, South Milwaukee, WI 53172   (Effective: 04-11-2015)
Prior: 1111 Marion Avenue # 203, South Milwaukee, WI 53172
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
